meanings.sent1: The freakish weather brought snow in the middle of summer.
meanings.sent2: Her freakish talent for mimicry impressed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: It was freakish how the cat could dance on two legs.
meanings.sent4: The freakish glow of the fireflies lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The freakish appearance of the comet left everyone in awe.

meanings.sent1: The freakish creature had three heads and wings.
meanings.sent2: The old house had a freakish atmosphere that gave me chills.
meanings.sent3: It was freakish to see a dog riding a skateboard down the street.
meanings.sent4: The freakish shadows in the haunted house made it even scarier.
meanings.sent5: The freakish sound of laughter echoed through the empty halls.

meanings.definition: Acting or behaving in a strange or unconventional way
meanings.sent1: She gave me a freakish look when I mentioned the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: His freakish habit of wearing mismatched socks always made people smile.
meanings.sent3: It was freakish how he could juggle while riding a unicycle.
meanings.sent4: The freakish way she sang opera while cooking dinner was entertaining.
meanings.sent5: The freakish dance moves at the talent show amazed the audience.
